availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Theodore N. Wise (Covington, Kenton County, Kentucky, physician.)

body.p: Covington, Kenton County, Kentucky, physician. Virginia native. Son of Nathaniel Seaton Wise and Jane Caroline McKnenny Wise. Married to Missouri Arnold Wise on June 1, 1837. Father of James S. Wise. Married to Catherine B. McGill Wise on November 9, 1852. Father of Theodore Wise. Physician in Covington, Kenton County, Kentucky, in 1850. Physician in Covington, Kenton County, in 1860. Employed Lucy Fury as a servant in Covington, Kenton County, in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Covington, Kenton County, in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington, Ward 3, p.247B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington Ward 3, p. 619
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Covington County, Covington Ward 3, p. 316A.
Birth and Death Records: Covington, Lexington, Louisville, and Newport (before 1911), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #7013567, Covington Deaths, p. 545.
W. H. Perrin, J. H. Battle, and G. C. Kniffin, Kentucky: A History of the State, 7th ed. (Louisville and Chicago: F. A. Battey and Company, 1887), 913.
